name: Provenance
description: Provenance of a resource is a record that describes entities and processes involved in producing and delivering or otherwise influencing that resource. Provenance provides a critical foundation for assessing authenticity, enabling trust, and allowing reproducibility. Provenance assertions are a form of contextual metadata and can themselves become important records with their own provenance. Provenance statement indicates clinical significance in terms of confidence in authenticity, reliability, and trustworthiness, integrity, and stage in lifecycle (e.g. Document Completion - has the artifact been legally authenticated), all of which may impact security, privacy, and trust policies.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: target
elements.description: The Reference(s) that were generated or updated by  the activity described in this resource. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: ./outboundRelationship[isNormalActRelationship() and typeCode=SUBJ]/target  OR  ./participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=SBJ]/role  OR  ./participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=SBJ]/role[isNormalRole()]/player

elements.name: occurred[x]
elements.description: The period during which the activity occurred.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: recorded
elements.short: When the activity was recorded / updated
elements.description: The instant of time at which the activity was recorded.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: policy
elements.short: Policy or plan the activity was defined by
elements.description: Policy or plan the activity was defined by. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: ./inboundRelationship[isNormalActRelationship() and typeCode="SUBJ"]/source[isNormalAct and subsumes(POLICY, classCode) and moodCode=EVN]/text[typeCode='ED'/tel

elements.name: location
elements.short: Where the activity occurred, if relevant
elements.description: Where the activity occurred, if relevant.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: unique(./participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode=LOC]/role[isNormalRole() and subsumes(SDLOC, classCode)]/player[isNormalEntity and classCode="LOC" and determinerCode="INST"]

elements.name: reason
elements.description: The reason that the activity was taking place.

binding.description: The reason the activity took place.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: activity
elements.description: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: agent
elements.description: An actor taking a role in an activity  for which it can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: type
elements.description: The participation the agent had with respect to the activity.

binding.description: The type of participation that a provenance agent played with respect to the activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: role
elements.description: The function of the agent with respect to the activity. The security role enabling the agent with respect to the activity.

binding.description: The role that a provenance agent played with respect to the activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: who
elements.description: The individual, device or organization that participated in the event.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: onBehalfOf
elements.description: The individual, device, or organization for whom the change was made.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Person, Practitioner, Organization, Device :* .role [classCode = RoleClassMutualRelationship; role.code and * .scopes[Role](classCode=IDENT) and *.plays [Role.Code]

elements.name: entity
elements.short: An entity used in this activity
elements.description: An entity used in this activity.

elements.name: role
elements.description: How the entity was used during the activity.

binding.description: How an entity was used in an activity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: what
elements.description: Identity of the  Entity used. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: agent
elements.short: Entity is attributed to this agent
elements.description: The entity is attributed to an agent to express the agent's responsibility for that entity, possibly along with other agents. This description can be understood as shorthand for saying that the agent was responsible for the activity which generated the entity.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: signature
elements.description: A digital signature on the target Reference(s). The signer should match a Provenance.agent. The purpose of the signature is indicated.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
